Q: Why is my member function treated like virtual when it is not declared as such in an intermediate base class? A:

Since area() in Rectangle is not virtual, it should call area() from Rectangle

It actually is virtual, since it was declared virtual in the base class. This attribute is automatically transferred to inherited classes' member function declarations.

See the standard, Virtual functions [class.virtual] (emphasis mine):

If a virtual member function vf is declared in a class Base and in a class Derived, derived directly or indirectly from Base, a member function vf with the same name, parameter-type-list (8.3.5), cv-qualification, and refqualifier (or absence of same) as Base::vf is declared, then Derived::vf is also virtual (whether or not it is so declared) and it overrides Base::vf.

Side remark. Derividg a square from a rectangle can be problematic as it violates Liskov substitution principle.

Q: How to set a background image in python pptx A:

Yes, it’s possible, but python-pptx doesn’t have a direct “set background image” helper. The workaround is to fill the slide background with a picture using the background fill API. Example:

from pptx import Presentation
from pptx.enum.shapes import MSO_FILL

prs = Presentation()
slide = prs.slides.add_slide(prs.slide_layouts[6])

bg = slide.background
fill = bg.fill
fill.solid()
fill.user_picture("path/to/image.jpeg")

prs.save("test.pptx")

This sets the image as the slide background. If you need more control (scaling, positioning, etc.), another option is to add the image as a full-size picture shape covering the entire slide, which is often simpler and more flexible.

Q: Not able to share entire screen on discord in Hyprland A:

Currently, Discord screen sharing does not work on Hyprland due to compatibility issues, which stem from Discord's side. The developers are aware of this and are actively working on a fix.

If you need screen sharing functionality right now, there are two options:

  • Use Discord Canary (Beta Version): Screen sharing works in the beta version of Discord (Discord Canary). However, since this is a beta version, it may not be perfectly stable, and using it comes with some inherent risks. Proceed only if you're comfortable with potential instability.

  • Use Discord in a Browser: The most reliable solution at the moment is to use Discord directly in a web browser. Screen sharing works seamlessly in this setup without any compatibility issues.

For a stable experience, the browser option is currently the best choice.

Q: What is the meson equivalent of CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX? A:

It's actually similar to the autotools convention in terms of the switch:

meson setup --prefix=/path/of/installation/destination build_dir
ninja -C build_dir
ninja -C build_dir install

(you could drop the first ninja command; ninja install will build before it installs.)

Q: cout vs. fprintf vs. fputs A:

Your function itself does not throw exceptions. That is not sufficient to mark a function as noexcept.

It must also either handle exceptions that are thrown within its scope (which this function is not well suited to do that), or only call other functions that are guaranteed not to throw (which may or may not be marked as noexcept).

Functions scoped as extern "C" may-or-may-not be allowed to throw. That is an implementation detail (iirc, platform specific) whether or not they are allowed to throw.

In my opinion, since your function is not suited to handle exceptions that may be thrown by functions it calls, it should not be marked as noexcept. Handling the exceptions is somebody else's problem.

As currently written, if a function called by your function throws, since your function is marked noexcept the in-flight exception will cause your function to terminate the process. Making that decision seems above the paygrade of your function.
